page.title: 10 Housing in West Wellow.
page.content: Housing in West Wellow is far from the church because of the plague which attacked the area in C.17th.The villagers burned down their old houses. Replacement houses were built away from the church.Before modernisation the housing consisted of farms and cottages found between Maury's Lane and Gazing Lane.Luke's Farm,Maury's Lane was built around 1685 of timber and wattle on flint,and clay with flagstone floors.It has seen many changes.The old post office,also C.17th,is made of half inch bricks.Another old C.18th cottage is Slab Cottage. Old cottages built in the C.17th surround Snobs Corner."Gables",Gazing Lane built of mud and wattle has a timber frame and slate roof.The rooms are dark because of small windows and low ceilings.Original wooden beams are still visible.
